message.content:
cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.PF, cs.CR 

The paper discusses the use of control theory in resource allocation in P2P networks, which falls under the category of systems and control (cs.SY). It also involves network infrastructure (cs.NI) and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC) as it deals with resource allocation in a distributed network. The paper also discusses the problem of freeriding and whitewashing, which falls under the category of cryptography and security (cs.CR). Finally, the paper proposes a modification to the transfer function to encourage genuine new comers to enter the network, which falls under the category of performance (cs.PF).
